00000.notes: Already mighty, a true master might have Altered Time Rate 1, Extra Attack 2, as well as Compartmentalized Mind and a broader selection of spells so they can cast and fight at the same time.

00000.title: Arcane Shield.
00000.notes: The wizard constantly maintains, at no cost, a DB 1 Shield spell. This inflicts -1 to all spell skills, but this effect is already accounted for in the spell list. Dropping the Shield raises all spell skills to 21.

00001.title: Master of Elemental Magic.
00001.notes: While several favorite spells are listed, this wizard knows the entire Air, Water, and Weather spell colleges at Skill-20.

00000.title: Challenge.
00000.notes: The animated armor challenges all who come closer than a set distance (maximum 20 yards). It recognizes its creator and may be set with a password. Fooling the construct by any means, mundane or magical, requires winning a Quick Contest vs. its Detect Lies skill.

00001.title: Half-Swording.
00001.notes: The creature may use its bastard sword like a jo, giving +2 Parry, Reach 1; damage becomes 1d+3 impaling or 1d+3 cutting. While thrusting, the penalty to target chinks in armor is reduced by –2.

00002.title: Sumo Shove.
00002.notes: The animated armor is +2 ST to grappling techniques, and +2 per die to slams and shoves.

00000.notes: Follow-up: Venomous Bite.
00000.name: Bite

00000.title: Augnarath Stink.
00000.notes: Their odor is both pungent and distinctive if you know what they smell like: +5 on Smell rolls to recognize an augnarath if you’ve smelled one before.

00001.title: Petrifying Gaze.
00001.notes: The augnarath may target one individual within 30 yards in its front hexes with a gaze attack that automatically hits. The victim sees a terrifying light, and must dodge (avert, close, or cover their eyes) or block (impose a barrier) or else suffer Petrifaction (['Exploits, p. 66'PDF:DFE66]). Victims turn to a spongy stone-like material if the defense is failed. The target may continue to fight with eyes averted using Wild Swings (['Exploits, p. 38'PDF:DFE38]) and defending as if they cannot see the attacker at –4 (['Exploits, p. 97'PDF:DFE97]). The effects are permanent unless removed by Remove Curse or Stone to Flesh; Dispel Magic won’t work.

00002.title: Venomous Bite.
00002.notes: If the augnarath’s bite penetrates DR, roll HT at –1 per point of penetrating damage. On a failure, the victim has the Slow condition (['Exploits, p. 65'PDF:DFE65]), acting every other turn. Increase the delay between actions for every failed save with additional bites.

00000.title: Corrosive Expectoration.
00000.notes: The baenadýrið can spit a blob of something. Roll 1d on the creature’s turn. On a roll of 5–6 it may use its spit attack. It clings tenaciously to the target, and inflicts 2 points of corrosion damage per second when it hits and for 3d seconds thereafter. The blob or spray is big enough, and spreads sufficiently upon impact, to be considered Large-area Injury (['Exploits, p. 53'PDF:DFE53]).
Large area injury.
00000.name: Bat Swarm

00000.title: Swarm of Bats.
00000.notes: Bats are not individually dangerous unless they carry disease (and bats can be rabid). In a swarm, the collective group has Air Move 8, inflict 1d cutting per second as Large Area Injury (['Exploits, p. 53'PDF:DFE53]), and takes 8 HP per hex to disperse.

00017.name: Supernatural Durability (All six arms are crippled)

00003.notes: Listed damage is for each tentacle, see Multiple Attacks. May parry weapons as per Judo skill.

00000.title: Multiple Attacks.
00000.notes: Can attack six times but can use each body part—arm (to use a weapon or grapple) or serpent tail (to grapple)—just once. Unwilling to negotiate. Truly evil. Some blaðakona have two extra long grappling tentacles in place of a pair of sword-arms. These have Wrestling-18 and Judo-18, allowing them to still parry weapons at no penalty.

00001.title: Tentacled Blaðakona.
00001.notes: Some rare blaðakona form with one pair of their human-like arms replaced with a pair of (very) long tentacles. Such creatures still have six attacks, but use these extra tentacles for grappling foes, frequently at range.

00000.title: Caustic Blisters.
00000.notes: The blister worm is covered with pustules filled with toxic and corrosive slime. It poisons any living thing it comes in contact with, leaving a dead and dessicated trail in its wake. Anything that does at least a point of damage coats whatever it touched in sticky goo, inflicting 1d corr damage and acting as a pain toxin (severe pain) on a failed HT roll. High Pain Threshold halves these penalties; Low Pain Threshold doubles them (['see Pain, Exploits, p. 65'PDF:DFE65]). Roll HT every hour after being affected; each success lowers the pain by one level.

00001.title: Pus.
00001.notes: Follow-up to grapple or a successful attack on the blister worm. 1d corrosion; HT roll to avoid pain.

00000.title: Where’d He Go?
00000.notes: Blóðughúfa can turn invisible by taking a Ready maneuver (['see Invisibility, Monsters, p. 11'PDF:DFM11]). Blóðughúfa use their limited invisibility for ambush, seeking to initiate combat with Surprise Attacks (['Exploits, pp. 26–27'PDF:DFE26]). If only the blóðughúfa can hide or effectively use invisibility, it will attempt Backstabbing (['Exploits, p.57'PDF:DFE57]).

00000.title: Once Bitten.
00000.notes: The monster example is an “out of the box” spawn, ready for use, but when bitten, a vampire spawn rises with their physical stats intact, but gains the following traits: +5 ST, +1 to DX, IQ, and HT. +2 to Will and Perception (in addition to the boost to IQ). +2 to Speed (and thus also to Move). If they do not already have Brawling and Wrestling, they get them both at DX+2 (or Karate and Judo for a properly Buffy feel); they get +2 to both skills if they have them already. They also are afflicted with the entire set of traits listed, plus Vampire Thrall.

00001.title: Thrall Spellcasting.
00001.notes: Blóðþrysta and their spawn are Truly Evil. Any powers or spells requiring Power Investiture (Clerical or Druidic) or Holiness are lost forever when a thrall is made. Magery and Bardic Talent are suppressed as long as the vampire is a thrall; Magery and Bardic Talent are restored fully if the sire is killed and the blóðþrysta survives the transition to sire.

00002.title: Vampire Thrall.
00002.notes: A blóðþrysta rises enslaved to the vampire sire that created it, and in mental stasis. A thrall Cannot Learn and is Hidebound. Upon rising, thralls must make a Will–2 roll. If they fail, they gain Slave Mentality; if they succeed, they have Reprogrammable instead. If the sire is killed, they lose the thrall traits, but make a Will roll at –4: On a failure, the thrall goes Berserk and stays that way until killed—which will probably happen as soon as the sun rises! If the roll succeeds, the thrall becomes a free agent, can sire new vampires, and gains: +5 ST; +1 to DX, IQ, and HT; +1 to Speed. They also regain wizardly or bardic spellcasting, and can learn new spells and skills.

00003.title: Equipment.
00003.notes: As a former Wall Warden, this spawn has chain mail, a fine dwarven axe, and a light medium buckler.

00000.title: Bolvaðr are typically very well armed with concealable body armor.
00000.notes: A common load might be an underlayer of fine giant spider silk armor (DR 2), over which is worn meteoric iron or elven fine light mail (DR 3). A plain-looking falchion—appearing serviceable at best—is actually an enchanted sword (Penetrating Weapon for the (2) armor divisor), while a truncheon is secretly a wizard’s wand.

00000.title: A Slender Rope.
00000.notes: Each tentacle has ST 14 and does 1d+2 control. The creature attacks a single victim with multiple tentacles.

00001.title: All at Once.
00001.notes: Attacking, the boráll hits with an additional tentacle for every point by which it makes its roll. An active defense avoids one tentacle on a success, plus an additional tentacle for every point by which the roll was made.

00002.title: Get Over Here!
00002.notes: The boráll first seizes a foe in its tentacles, then reels them in. This is a variant of Grab and Go (['Fantastic Dungeon Grappling, p. 5'PDF:FDG5]). Roll a Quick Contest of the tentacle’s ST 14 vs the ST +4 of the target, but add +7 to the ST roll for each additional tentacle grappling the target. If it wins, it pulls the victim towards it as if it had Move 10.

00000.title: Directional Hearing.
00000.notes: Melted-folk ears provide very detailed information on the direction and distance of noises they can hear, providing a biological passive Sonar capability (['Monsters, p. 12'PDF:DFM12]). This is not echolocation, like bats and dolphins—it will never give the listener away! If they can hear it, they can see it!

00004.notes: (18 vs. Hearing if moving, 22 if motionless.)
00004.name: Stealth

00000.name: Spit Poison

00000.title: Telekinetic Arms.
00000.notes: The brenglaðr ormur can project up to four telekinetic arms by taking a Concentrate maneuver. These behave in all respects as normal arms used offensively, and as orichalcum weapons when used defensively! They cannot be broken or damaged. The ormur may parry once each with its four arms. Its body plus four limbs provides an extra +2 per die (+6 total with all four arms on one target) to control points.

00000.title: Total Regeneration.
00000.notes: Each time a breyttdýr kills and eats a sapient being, it gains the ability to completely regenerate to full health and fatigue a single time. It must consume a fresh kill to replenish this ability (bite victim down to -10×HP). Unless the heroes happen to be on hand when the monster appears, assume it’s killed someone, and can regenerate. When badly wounded, at -2×HP or below, it regenerates and then flees to find easier prey to replenish the ability.

00000.title: Super Jump (2 yards).
00000.notes: Cats can jump five to six times their height both vertically and horizontally (their musculature is optimized for height). More generally, look up a feline’s SM +3 on the length scale on the Size and Speed/Range Table (['Exploits, p. 98'PDF:DFE98]) to find the maximum distance a cat can leap.

00000.notes: Make a roll vs HT–4; victim suffers -1 DX and IQ due to pain on a success, moderate pain on a failure, and -3 DX and IQ for pain on a critical failure. High Pain Threshold halves these penalties; Low Pain Threshold doubles them. Every 12 hours, make a HT–2 roll; the pain subsides on a success.

00000.title: Spiffy Gear.
00000.notes: The fanatic’s gear is a cut above the typical peasant, as their Wealth allows some choices. A light mail shirt on the body is concealable and provides reasonable protection. A long knife can be used either in the primary hand or secondary, and a fine hatchet or axe adds a bit of extra sharpness to the cheddar. Can arm up a DB 2 shield when needed.

00001.title: Status and Reputation.
00001.notes: It is possible that the fanatic has achieved some level of respect and position with proper society, perhaps from pre-cult life, perhaps because of dark dalliances. If so, add appropriate Traits and Skills.

00000.title: Really Unfair Death Jet.
00000.notes: Much like Deathtouch, but the cultist can cast it as a jet spell (['Spells, p. 12'PDF:DFS12]) with Reach 10. Cannot be maintained. Costs 1 FP per 1d injury. Bolt can resemble almost anything, from crazy Palpatinic purple lightning to a burst of sickly ichor.

00001.title: Invited Guest.
00001.notes: The warlock is harboring a demon spirit. Grants the warlock the traits listed with an asterisk (*) when it is allowed to take control, but also causes the warlock to be susceptible to any abilities that affect demons and the Truly Evil. It has Will-16 for the purposes of exorcism.

00000.title: Dark Bond.
00000.notes: In addition to using Pack Tactics (['Monsters p. 7'PDF:DFM7]), so long as a pack has at least 10 active members in a fight, each member has +1 to all rolls, as if they were under a permanent Bless spell (['Spells p. 50'PDF:DFS50]). If their numbers drop below 10, they lose their bonus and become enraged, and do +3 damage on attacks instead.

00001.title: Health Food.
00001.notes: The members of a dark pack do not heal naturally. By devouring a slain foe over several minutes, they restore HP equal to the maximum HP of the foe killed to members of their pack. Hit Points are restored from least injured to most injured … including members of the pack who are not yet at –10×HP. With the right set of meals, any pack members not totally destroyed can rejoin and hunt again.

00002.title: Terrifying Howl.
00002.notes: A dark pack opens a fight by spending 1 HP each, and howling in unison to produce Terror (['Monsters, p. 12'PDF:DFM12]). Individual pack members also howl as if they had Kiai-15 (['Adventurers p. 32'PDF:DFA32]): If they win a Quick Contest of Howl-15 vs the target’s Will, the target is mentally stunned. The undead wolf is at –1 to Howl per full two yards of distance from the target. Enemies who cannot hear resist at +2.

00000.title: A Slender Rope.
00000.notes: Each tentacle of a dauðagrip has effective ST 13 and does 1d control. The creature usually tries to attack with multiple tentacles.

00001.title: Get Over Here!
00001.notes: The dauðagrip first seizes a foe in its tentacles, then reels them in. This is a variant of Grab and Go (['Fantastic Dungeon Grappling, p. 5'PDF:FDG5]). Roll a Quick Contest of the tentacle’s ST 13 vs the ST +4 of the target, but the dauðagrip adds +6 to the ST roll for each additional tentacle grappling the target. If it wins, it pulls the victim towards it as if it had Move 10. Example: If a ST 14 foe is grabbed with 2 tentacles, the Quick Contest is the dauðagrip ST 19 vs the foe’s effective ST 18. If it wins, ST 14 is more than half of ST 19, so it pulls the victim 5 yards towards it. If it can pull into C, it bites.

00002.title: I Am Not an Animal.
00002.notes: The dauðagrip is smart enough that Animal spells won’t work—use Mind Control magic.

00003.title: So Many Arms.
00003.notes: The dauðagrip averages six arms, but can have more. A lot more. Roll 2d–1 for number of arms, and if any dice show a 6, reroll it once and add that to the total, to a maximum of 23 arms. ['See Number of Limbs, Fantastic Dungeon Grappling, p. 3 for details'PDF:FGD3].

00001.title: I Was Aiming for His Head.
00001.notes: If the dökkkápa hits the torso, it tries to envelop the head with an engulfing attack. Roll a normal grappling attack at –3; success envelopes the head, causing Suffocation (['Exploits, p. 70'PDF:DFE70]).

00002.title: Plummet Attack.
00002.notes: When the dökkkápa drops on a victim from above, if it hits with the slam attack, it automatically rolls for its engulfing attack. If the attack roll succeeds by 3 or more, it hits the head.

00003.notes: Six feet of razor-thin wire; each end attaches once to any surface. Per–3 to notice in full daylight. Inflicts victim’s slam damage as cutting, with (2) armor divisor. Can be ducked under or cut with any blade to disarm. 0.2 lbs.

00004.title: 2 – Boomer.
00004.notes: A small silvery orb. Once activated, touch sets off a Concussion blast (['Spells, p. 15'PDF:DFS15]) doing 4d cr. 0.5 lbs.

00005.title: 3 – Caltrops.
00005.notes: As per ['Adventurers, p. 113'PDF:DFA113], but thr+1 imp. 0.5 lbs.

00006.notes: Treat as a 3-hex Grease (['Spells, p. 57'PDF:DFS57]). Lasts 1d hours. 1 lb.

00007.title: 5 – Nagateppo.
00007.notes: Pouch contains 5 nagateppo (['see Adventurers, p. 113'PDF:DFA113]). 1 lb.

00008.title: 6 – Ratarang.
00008.notes: In a dökktomte’s hands these rat-shaped fine shuriken return to the dökktomte’s hand if they fail to hit. Dodge or Block are at –2; Parry at –6. 10 ratarangs per lb.

00000.title: Before the Thunder…
00000.notes: His affinity for weather and storms has led to great … efficiency … with both lightning and thunder. Treat Agobngir as having Magery 6 with the Sound and Weather colleges.

00001.title: Kiai.
00001.notes: When Agobngir wants to target a particular foe, he uses Kiai instead of his breath weapon. He’s really good at it: Ignore the rule of 16 and give him full Kiai-20 in the contest.

00002.title: Plodding.
00002.notes: The dragon is only Move 6 on the ground

00003.title: Shapeshifter.
00003.notes: He can change into several different creatures, including a human and a brilliantly colored housecat.

00004.title: Sound Barrier.
00004.notes: Not that one. Agobngir is impervious to sound as if he were always maintaining Resist Sound (['Spells, p. 67'PDF:DFS67]), but it doesn’t count as a spell on.

00005.title: Thunderous Exhalation.
00005.notes: The dragon’s breath weapon is a visible wall of sound and fury! A 1-yard-wide × 10-yard-long cone causes anyone caught within to roll HT-4 or suffer physical stun (['Exploits, p. 60'PDF:DFE60]). Anyone within three yards of the cone must make a HT roll or be deafened; those deafened may roll vs. HT every hour to recover. If the cone lands in an enclosed area—less than 10 yards in any dimension—increase this distance to six yards!

00002.title: Web Sense.
00002.notes: While in contact with a web, the edderkop knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

00003.title: Webslinger.
00003.notes: Each second, the edderkop can cover the ground in one hex with webbing or spin a web at a target within 10 yards. Ground webbing doubles movement point costs for ground movement. Strung horizontally, entering a webbed zone inflicts 2d control points. Each unsuccessful attempt to break free inflicts 2d more to a maximum of 26. Even a single point of fire damage will clear a hex of webs, the same damage to those trapped within.

00004.title: Web Walker.
00004.notes: The edderkop ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

00002.notes: Balanced, Fine, Ornate +1.
00002.name: Dueling Glaive

00000.title: Equipment.
00000.notes: The Mysterious are gifted by their elders with a balanced, fine dueling glaive. It is a normal-sized weapon, $1,200 and 6 lbs. As a Power Item, it provides 9 FP.
Dwarven.
00000.name: Long Axe

00000.title: Baleful Glare.
00000.notes: The creature casts spells by glaring at its victim; sickly flames flare in the rotting sockets momentarily and the spell is cast. The eirðarlaus suffers no range penalties on its spellcasting so long as it can see the target and is casting within the area it is assigned to protect.

00001.title: Cursed!
00001.notes: The eirðarlaus can inflict either of the undead curses on a victim it can see by taking a Concentrate maneuver. A popular send-off if delvers withdraw!

00002.title: Magical Wellspring.
00002.notes: The energy reserve of the monster completely replenishes at sunset every day.

00003.title: Mob Zombie.
00003.notes: The eirðarlaus can animate dead in the form of skeletons or zombies (depending on the state of the remains). The eirðarlaus takes a Concentrate maneuver, and 1d undead rise the following turn to attack any target the eirðarlaus chooses. The eirðarlaus can animate undead in number equal to its Will, and dismiss them as it likes.

00004.title: Plague of Insects.
00004.notes: Once per day, as a free action on its turn, the eirðarlaus summons a seven-hex swarm of nasty creatures per ['Monsters, p. 54'PDF:DFM54] or Undead Swarms. It may also summon scarabs, treated as land-bound piranha with Move 5G. Swarms last an hour, then vanish.

00005.title: Spells.
00005.notes: The eirðarlaus knows the entire Body Control college at Skill-15, and could easily have other favorite spells (Sandstorm and Sand Jet seem apropos). Those listed are some favorites based on the “pain and agony” flavor of mummy, plus a few needful spells to keep it hale.

00000.notes: May bite and worry.
00000.name: Bite

00000.notes: See Special Abilities.
00000.name: Lightning Jet

00000.title: I Am Not an Animal.
00000.notes: The eldingarlaun is smart enough that Animal spells won’t work—use Mind Control magic.

00001.title: Lightning Jet.
00001.notes: The eldingarlaun exhales a lightning jet with Reach 7. Avoiding the line requires a successful retreating Dodge. The attack does 4d damage, metal armor is treated as only DR 1, and any target hit must make a HT roll at –1 per 2 HP suffered or be physically stunned as per the Lightning spell (['Spells, p. 71'PDF:DFS71]).

00002.title: Swallow.
00002.notes: The eldingarlaun may attempt to Swallow Whole (['Fantastic Dungeon Grappling, p. 8'PDF:FDG8]) a victim of SM 0 or smaller.

00000.notes: Treat as weapon, not as body part. Gathering Storm can further increase damage.
00000.name: Air Blast

00000.notes: Follow-up: Physical Stun. Costs 1 FP per use.
00000.name: Lightning Bolt

00000.title: All Blown Out.
00000.notes: The air elemental is very dependent on Fatigue Points for its powers. It has a lot of them, but the GM needs to keep track, and if it passes through 1/3 FP, it will probably withdraw—it’s a force of nature, but it’s not stupid.

00001.title: Alternate Form.
00001.notes: The elemental can change form from “angry stormcloud” to “misty fog.” It may not attack at all in this form, but gains Chameleon 5 and Stealth-12.

00002.title: Gathering Storm.
00002.notes: Costs 5 FP to use. Allows the elemental to pull in mist and fog from the surroundings, increasing its size to SM +3, and ST to 35 for 10 minutes. Increase Air Blast to 4d+3 crushing, Reach C–3.

00003.title: Hailstorm.
00003.notes: Costs 2 FP to use. Everyone within two yards of the elemental takes 1d–2 crushing damage per second as Large-Area Injury (['Exploits, p. 53'PDF:DFE53]). Lasts for one minute. If the elemental has increased its size using Gathering Storm, range increases to 4 yards, damage becomes 2d–1.

00004.title: Summoned!
00004.notes: Add Reprogrammable and Unnatural; they vanish instantly if wounded to -1×HP, and dismissable by the Banish spell (['Spells, pp. 59–60'PDF:DFS59]).

00005.title: Thunderclap.
00005.notes: Costs 2 FP per use. Everyone within two yards of elemental must make a HT roll or be physically stunned (roll vs. HT every turn to recover). Unaffected by DR, but doesn’t affect the deaf.

00006.title: Whirling Fury.
00006.notes: 6d crushing for knockback only (no damage). Affects anyone touched by elemental or touching it in close combat. Doesn’t affect those who hit elemental with weapons, but does let elemental strike and parry as if armed.

00007.title: Physical Stun:
00007.notes: An injured target must roll vs. HT at -1 per 2 points of penetrating damage or be physically stunned; also must roll vs. HT at same penalty every turn to recover.

00000.notes: See Special Abilities.
00000.name: Fire Vortex

00000.title: Combustion.
00000.notes: Fire elementals don’t breathe and can’t be gassed or strangled, but require air in order to burn, experiencing Suffocation (['Exploits, p. 70'PDF:DFE70]) without it: FP loss, and then HP loss until death.

00001.title: Summoned!
00001.notes: Summoned elementals add Reprogrammable and Unnatural; they vanish instantly if wounded to -1×HP and can also be dismissed by the Banish spell (['Spells, pp. 59–60'PDF:DFS59]).

00002.title: Fire Vortex.
00002.notes: 4d burning damage to anyone in the same hex with the fire tornado. This can destroy weapons and armor (Damage to Objects, ['Exploits, pp. 55–56'PDF:DFE55]), though the danger should be obvious beforehand. The damage is applied as soon as the target shares the same hex as the vortex, and the vortex can move through several targets with a Move and Attack, damaging each one as it does.

00000.notes: Follow-up: [2d burn].
00000.name: Lava Punch

00000.notes: Follow-up: [4d burn] as Large-Area Injury. See Your Face is Lava.
00000.name: Lava Bomb

00000.title: Hot Bod.
00000.notes: Being in the same hex with or striking the lava elemental does 2d burning per second. This also applies to weapons: treat metal weapons as having DR 6, wooden as DR 4. Grappling with the creature inflicts 4d per second burning damage.

00001.title: Summoned!
00001.notes: Summoned elementals add Reprogrammable and Unnatural; they vanish instantly if wounded to -1×HP, and can also be dismissed by the Banish spell (['Spells, pp. 59–60'PDF:DFS59]).

00002.title: The Floor is Lava.
00002.notes: The elemental leaves a trail of molten rock underneath and behind it, one yard wide and perhaps a foot deep. Stepping on a lava hex—including the one the monster is standing in—does 4d damage per second for the first five minutes after the elemental passes, halved every five minutes thereafter and cool enough to walk on after 15 minutes.

00003.title: Tunneling.
00003.notes: The lava elemental retains the ability to move through rock and earth at Move 3, navigating by Absolute Direction, Dark Vision, and Subsonic Hearing. It melts through as it goes, leaving restored tunnels in rock, and disrupted tunnels in loose earth (they solidify to solid rock).

00004.title: Your Face is Lava.
00004.notes: The lava bombs thrown by the elemental are yellow-hot and highly fluid, making them both heavy and sticky. They also weigh about 200 lbs. On impact, they hit the target for crushing and burning damage, but also splash as an area effect, doing 2d burning damage as Large-Area Injury in the surrounding hexes. If it misses, it is subject to Scatter (['Exploits, p. 45'PDF:DFE45]).

00000.notes: -1 per yard, as Regular spell. Max 3 FP (3d–3 injury). As per spell (['Spells, p. 68'PDF:DFS68]).
00000.name: Dehydrate

00001.notes: 1 yard per FP spent. As per spell (['Spells, p. 71'PDF:DFS71]). Face hit means combat skills are at -3 next turn.
00001.name: Water Jet

00000.title: Aqua Lung.
00000.notes: If the undine grapples a foe’s head for at least a –4 penalty to DX, they may suffocate the foe as a free action. The target may attempt to break free normally.

00001.title: Aria!
00001.notes: If the undine cannot sing, or the subjects cannot hear her song, the magic has no effect.

00002.title: Eager to Comply.
00002.notes: The undine knows Song of Command (['Adventurers, p. 18'PDF:DFA18]) and uses it at Skill-12.

00003.title: Soul Subject.
00003.notes: If the undine can marry a sapient mortal, who consents to the union of their own free will, they gain a human soul and body. They lose traits marked with an asterisk (*), but retain Bardic Talent 4, their other skills, and can breathe water as if they had gills.

00004.title: Summoned!
00004.notes: Summoned elementals add Reprogrammable and Unnatural; they vanish instantly if wounded to -1×HP, and can also be dismissed by the Banish spell (['Spells, pp. 59–60'PDF:DFS59]).

00005.title: Water Friend.
00005.notes: The undine can walk on water at full move as if on solid ground, and see through (clean) water as if it were air. Obstructions such as silt still occlude vision.

00002.notes: 27 lbs.
00002.name: Oversized Maul

00000.notes: Follow-up: [1d toxic].
00000.name: Claw

00000.title: Mark of the Faithless.
00000.notes: If a potential victim commits an act of voluntary corruption at the falleglygi’s suggestion, roll a Quick Contest of Will. If the falleglygi wins, all mind-influencing spells, including Weaken Will, are treated as within touching distance, even across realms or dimensions. The mark can be removed through exorcism; it is at –10 to detect!

00001.title: Mojo.
00001.notes: The demon uses Mind-Search and Mind-Reading to learn their foes’ exploitable disadvantages. Armed with that knowledge, make a complementary Psychology roll, then a victorious Quick Contest of Fast-Talk vs. Will results in voluntary corruption. If the demon must stay close to the victim, Acting maintains the lie.

00002.title: On the Sly.
00002.notes: While a vigorous illicit smooch is but one example, the falleglygi always conceals its spellcasting within other activities. The spells cast are nearly impossible to detect (–10, as with the Mark of the Faithless).

00003.title: Self-Serve.
00003.notes: The demon spends its own FP on Weaken Will; when the spell’s duration elapses, Will and max FP for the victim are each reduced by 1 so long as the Mark of the Faithless is active. The victim’s own FP power the maintained spell.

00004.title: Shape and Size.
00004.notes: Falleglygi ST and DX range from 9 to 14; the other stats are more static.

00005.title: The Wages of Sin.
00005.notes: If the falleglygi wins the resistance roll for Weaken Will during an act of voluntary corruption (['Spells, p. 14'PDF:DFS14]; apply the Rule of 16 from ['Exploits, p. 8'PDF:DFE8]!) by 10 or more, the demon can eat the soul of the victim. Consuming the soul provides extra Energy Reserve equal to the remaining Will; it dissipates at dawn. The soul is consumed utterly and cannot be re-joined to the body through resurrection or any other means: The gods cannot save you from your own choices!

00006.title: Voluntary Corruption.
00006.notes: The creature can certainly cast spells to manipulate its targets, but when the victim gives in to a disadvantage or breaks faith with friends or loved ones on their own, this provides a window for the falleglygi to start getting a grip on the soul.

00000.notes: Follow-up: [1d+1 burn].
00000.name: Burning Bite

00002.notes: Always uses all four limbs to grapple.
00002.name: Grapple

00000.title: Demon Shot.
00000.notes: These small rocks are hot to the touch at all times. When they strike, they explode with a linked 1d cutting attack in the impact hex, releasing a fiendling. 1 lb, $200, not usually for sale; temples pay this just to make sure they are destroyed properly.

00001.title: Nettlesome Grapple.
00001.notes: Fiendlings grapple en masse: Each fiendling contributes Control Points as usual. While grappling, fiendling rolls Spiny Punch damage each turn as a free action (akin to worrying).

00002.title: Sticky Stinky Fireball.
00002.notes: Before they charge into battle, they “ready” and hurl a ball of sticky, pungent, flaming…material. If it hits, in addition to its basic damage, it does 1d corr for the next five rounds. If it misses, roll for Scatter (['Exploits, p. 45'PDF:DFE45]). Wherever it lands fills a one-yard area with flame doing 1d burning for five seconds.

00000.title: Icy Weapon.
00000.notes: As the Icy Weapon spell (['Spells, pp. 69–70'PDF:DFS69]), but applies to all strikes and grapples made by the fjallatroll. Inflicts an extra 2 points of injury if an attack penetrates DR (or a grapple is applied to an unarmored location).
Swallow Whole. Prey begins to suffocate (['Exploits, p. 70'PDF:DFE70]).
00000.name: Bite

00000.title: Super Jump.
00000.notes: Frogs are prodigious jumpers, and can cover a distance 20× their body length. Find a frog’s jump distance by looking up the frog’s Size Modifier +8 (!!) on the Size and Speed/Range Table (['Exploits, p. 98'PDF:DFE98]). A SM 0 giant frog can leap an astonishing 50 yards, and is treated as having Move 50 for the purposes of slams and pounces when jumping. Toads prefer shorter hops: add 2–4 to the SM to get jumping distance.

00009.name: Regeneration (1 HP per hour in freezing weather)

00000.notes: Frequently accompanied by Frostbite as follow-up: 1 FP per 1d direct injury up to 3d.
00000.name: Punch

00000.notes: Max of 3 FP (3d–3 imp).
00000.name: Ice Dagger

00000.title: Blizzard.
00000.notes: As Sandstorm (['Spells, p. 16'PDF:DFS16]) but carrying flying snow and ice. Costs 5 FP to create a storm with a 10-yard area, and 2 FP per additional minute to maintain.

00001.title: Frosty Blink.
00001.notes: By spending 1 FP, the frostalf can vanish from view and reappear up to 10 yards away, so long as it appears on snow or ice and is not in contact with iron. This can be done as an active defense (roll Dodge), no Body Sense roll required.

00002.title: Popsicle.
00002.notes: Grabbing the frostalf inflicts a 1d Frostbite spell on the assailant at no cost to the frostalf. Armor protects as usual.

00003.title: Trackless.
00003.notes: A frostalf walks over snow and ice as if under the effects of Light Tread (['Spells, p. 57'PDF:DFS57]).

00000.title: Food Value.
00000.notes: Assume that a bird will yield roughly 2× its Basic Lift in number of meals for an adventurer.

00001.title: Top Speed.
00001.notes: Game birds top speeds vary tremendously by species. Geese are as listed; pheasants can peak at Move 30 in short bursts; grouse are plodding at Move 10. Quail hit Move 17, and most ducks can push Move 25. Treat base Air Move as 1/3 top speed.

00000.title: Food Value.
00000.notes: Assume that a bird will yield roughly 2× its Basic Lift in number of meals for an adventurer.

00001.title: Top Speed.
00001.notes: Game birds top speeds vary tremendously by species. Geese are as listed; pheasants can peak at Move 30 in short bursts; grouse are plodding at Move 10. Quail hit Move 17, and most ducks can push Move 25. Treat base Air Move as 1/3 top speed.

00000.title: Food Value.
00000.notes: Assume that a bird will yield roughly 2× its Basic Lift in number of meals for an adventurer.

00000.notes: Assume that a bird will yield roughly 2× its Basic Lift in number of meals for an adventurer.

00000.notes: Assume that a bird will yield roughly 2× its Basic Lift in number of meals for an adventurer.

00001.title: Top Speed.
00001.notes: Game birds top speeds vary tremendously by species. Geese are as listed; pheasants can peak at Move 30 in short bursts; grouse are plodding at Move 10. Quail hit Move 17, and most ducks can push Move 25. Treat base Air Move as 1/3 top speed.

00011.name: Odious Racial Habit (Eats other sapient beings, -3 reactions)

00000.notes: Bites also count as grapples; may worry. Septic bite.
00000.name: Bite

00002.notes: A miner’s pick used in two hands. Targets chinks with a reduced penalty by –2; may get stuck (['see Picks, Exploits, p. 39'PDF:DFE39]).
00002.name: Pick

00000.title: Septic Bite.
00000.notes: Their teeth are filthy, with bits of rotting flesh stuck in them from prior meals. Anyone injured by their bite must roll vs. HT–2 to avoid an infection until treated with Cure Disease. See Septic Bite for the full, icky details.

00001.title: Tunnel Lizard.
00001.notes: The gangaeðla are tireless diggers and are capable of very quickly making labyrinthine tunnel complexes in even the most stubborn soils; tools are required to work rocks. They may not be as artistic as the dwarves, but what they lack in fine craftsmanship they make up in speed.

00002.title: Voice-activated Dinosaur.
00002.notes: Some gangaeðla learn to command a risaeðla (dinosaur) using shrill voice commands as a free action. The dinosaurs aren’t very bright, though: The commands must be simple (one or two words: “Attack him,” “Go there,” “Run away,” or “Hulk smash.” Make an Animal Handling roll for each command or the animal does whatever suits its nature.

00000.notes: (Max 40). Reach C–5.
00000.name: Pseudopod

00000.title: Devour.
00000.notes: The corrosive slime consumes its target, painfully dissolving living flesh and bone…but not metal or gear. The process is mystical, not biological: it eats the delver but not their stuff; it eats constructs or animated undead, but not their stuff. It eats rules lawyers, but not their stuff. Devour is a large area injury attack doing 1d+1 corrosion damage (['Exploits, p. 53'PDF:DFE53]) as a free action each turn once a gel-o-mold has engulfed a target. Upon being engulfed, the target must make a HT roll or be Blinded. On a critical failure, this is permanent.

00001.title: Engulf.
00001.notes: If the gel-o-mold makes a close combat attack against an SM 0 or smaller creature, it engulfs its target if it can enter its hex. The only defense is a retreating dodge. Failure is treated as being pinned or inflicting 40 Control Points on the target. Any victim that must breathe experiences Suffocation (['Exploits, p. 70'PDF:DFE70]). If the gel-o-mold wishes to move away from its current location (even a step) it must release its target unless it weighs less than 20 lbs.

00009.name: Divine Curse (Don’t rest until task is accomplished)

00000.notes: Armor does not protect.
00000.name: Withering Touch

00000.title: Astral Vision.
00000.notes: The ghost can see as if it were under the influence of permanent Astral Vision (['Spells, p. 42'PDF:DFS42]).

00001.title: Boo!
00001.notes: Ghosts can choose to inflict Terror (['Monsters, p. 12'PDF:DFM12]) on those who can see it as a free action. Those who can must roll a Fright Check at –3 when the ghost activates the power.

00002.title: Energy Reserve.
00002.notes: The ghost has no FP, but has an Energy Reserve for spellcasting equal to its Will, that recovers at the usual rate.

00003.title: Possession.
00003.notes: The ghost can take control of another being as if it could cast Control Person-13.
Ideally delivered as an All-Out Attack from behind.
00003.name: Knobbed Club

00000.title: Paralyzing Touch.
00000.notes: If a ghoul hits, parries with Brawling, or is parried or blocked, it inflicts a momentary paralysis on the target—the only defense is to dodge! Roll HT–2; on a failure, the foe is stunned. Roll HT–2 again each turn; on a success, the effect ends and the victim may act normally.
Usually All-Out Attacks. Can worry (see Grind).
00000.name: Bite

00001.notes: Usually All-Out Attacks.
00001.name: Grapple

00000.title: Grind.
00000.notes: The ormur executes its worry attack with a separate set of teeth, which make the damage 10d (2).

00000.title: Injury Reduction.
00000.notes: The grendelkin takes half damage from even iron and steel weapons, and anything other than iron or steel has its damage quartered.

00001.notes: Can worry with talons.
00001.name: Talons

00000.notes: May bite and worry.
00000.name: Bite

00000.notes: With Wrestling.
00000.name: Grapple

00001.notes: Follow-up: [1d burn]. 43.75 lbs.
00001.name: Greatsword

00002.notes: Follow-up: [1d burn]. 43.75 lbs.
00002.name: Greatsword

00003.notes: Executed the turn after a successful parry, or having established a grapple. May spend Control Points to Injure the Foe (['Fantastic Dungeon Grappling, p. 5'PDF:FDG5]).
00003.name: Judo Throw

00000.notes: Targets all front hexes. DX roll at –1 per hex of knockback or fall down.
00000.name: Wing Buffet

00000.title: Incendiary Weapon.
00000.notes: Any weapon the tyrann holds becomes surrounded by flame on command, and delivers an additional 1d burning damage follow-up.

00001.title: Infernal Auras.
00001.notes: This most powerful of tyrann can take a Concentrate maneuver and produce one of the following effects. Treat each as an Area spell at Skill-27 when rolling for resistance. The aura has a 3-yard radius and can be placed anywhere so long as the demon is standing within it at no further penalty. These auras can be projected as Area spells, at –1 per yard. The Rule of 16 applies to all of these abilities; none have any obvious sensory presence (spells or abilities that detect magical emanations still work fine). Unless their hand is forced, grimmdar engage in boastful and long-winded monologues about how feeble their foes are and wax lyrical about their opponents’ inevitable defeat. All the while, they are using Wavering Morale to soften up their opponents.

00002.title: Bad Feeling About This.
00002.notes: The subject’s hands start shaking, they begin to sweat, and really, losing the last meal all over the floor is imminent: All in the area suffer from Nausea (['Exploits, p. 65'PDF:DFE65]) for 1 minute. Resisted by the lower of Will or HT. Costs 2 FP.

00003.title: Frozen with Fear.
00003.notes: The targets suffer similar to the Rooted Feet spell: they cannot move or change facing, and they are at –2 to all melee combat skills and half Dodge (round down). Resisted by Will (not ST!), but the subjects can make a new resistance roll at –5 each turn. Lasts 10 seconds. Costs 3 FP.

00004.title: Rout.
00004.notes: All in the area flee in mindless fear; if they cannot skedaddle, they must take the All-Out Defend maneuver. Lasts 1 minute. Resisted by Will. Costs 2 FP.

00005.title: Wavering Morale.
00005.notes: Everyone in the area are at –1 to Will for each time this aura washes over them (the effects are cumulative). The effect lasts for 1 minute. Resisted by Will. Costs 1 FP.

00006.title: Omniscient Eye.
00006.notes: The grimmard’s Detect abilities can sense life with Per-17, giving a 12 or less to detect folks sneaking up on it at 15 yards. It also can see as if constantly maintaining Astral Vision, Dark Vision, Know Illusion, Infravision, See Invisible, and Mage Sight. It knows you’re there: It sees spirits and insubstantial entities, sees through darkness, detects heat, cannot be fooled by illusion or invisibility, and sees magic.

00007.title: Shapeshifter.
00007.notes: The demon can shapeshift into the form of a human. It retains all of its abilities, including its ST, but can pass for an attractive, charismatic human. This takes a single Concentrate maneuver.

00008.title: Wing Buffet.
00008.notes: In addition to simply being able (and eager) to take flight while fighting, the grimmdar can initiate a buffet. This blast extends into all the grimmdar’s front hexes, out to 15 yards, and deals 12d damage, knockback only, to all in the zone. Anyone caught in the blast must make a DX roll at a penalty of –1 per hex of knockback suffered, or fall down.

00004.name: Dependency (Water, 2d per hour if out of water)

00001.notes: Attacks as 3-yard-wide jet attack between ormur and target.
00001.name: Crushing Tail

00000.title: Swallow Whole.
00000.notes: Can swallow anything SM +3 or smaller. Swallowed creatures must defeat Control DR 30 or cut their way out with cutting injury in excess of 170 points (!).
Dwarven.
00000.name: Dueling Glaive

00001.notes: Dwarven.
00001.name: Dueling Glaive

00002.notes: Uses Swimming skill, at –2 for kick.
00002.name: Kick

00001.notes: Side and rear hexes only.
00001.name: Tail Bash

00000.title: I Am Not an Animal.
00000.notes: The halaþyrna is too smart for Animal spells to work—use Mind Control magic.

00001.title: Nimble Tail.
00001.notes: The halaþyrna is particularly adept with its tail, and strikes into its side hexes at no penalty, and to the rear at -4 rather than as a Wild Swing.

00002.title: Thorny Regeneration.
00002.notes: Each night as it sleeps, the halaþyrna regenerates its tail spikes, a different number each time. Roll 10+1d, and that’s how many spikes it has ready each morning.

00003.title: Winged Flight.
00003.notes: The halaþyrna flies with Move 6/15, slower than it runs.

00000.notes: Can worry.
00000.name: Bite

00001.notes: Includes bonus from metal gauntlet.
00001.name: Claw

00000.notes: Costs 2 FP to use.
00000.name: Breath Weapon

00000.notes: Roll for physical stun.
00000.name: Shocking Blast

00000.title: Bane.
00000.notes: Any damage from fire or sunlight—or that affects spirts—destroys the haturljós utterly. It’s not hard to kill if you know how it’s done. It’s just sneaky, fast, and mean.

00001.title: Consume Life.
00001.notes: The ability is only usable on an unconscious victim. The target rolls HT–4, and loses 1d HT on a failure; the haturljós first heals HP, then replenishes its ER, with this drain. If HT is lowered to 0, the victim dies. HT recovers at 1 per 10 minutes.

00002.title: Light.
00002.notes: Either by choice, or when it attacks, the haturljós emits bright light (as continual light) in a circle 1d yards wide.

00003.title: Shocking.
00003.notes: As per the Lightning spell, treat any metal armor as DR 1. A target who takes any injury at all must make a HT roll, at –1 per 2 HP suffered, or be physically stunned. The victim may attempt a HT roll each turn thereafter to recover.

00000.title: Backstab.
00000.notes: Against a truly defenseless foe (including one with DX 0 or below via application of Control Points), add +1d thrust and +2d swing to all melee attacks.

00000.title: Gear.
00000.notes: This sample Neveri horse archer has brigandine torso armor and light scale on the legs and arms. She’s armed with a composite bow which she can shoot while riding at no penalty to either Bow or Riding, as well as a curved cavalry broadsword and small shield. The shield is strapped to the arm, allowing the use of the bow via a thumb draw.

00001.title: Knee Control.
00001.notes: Neveri horse archers can control their mounts with their knees, allowing use of both hands and still retaining full control of their mount. The horse must also be trained in this technique (see Saddle Training).

00000.notes: Follow-up: [1d toxic]. Roll HT–2 or suffer from Nausea for 1d minutes.
00000.name: Claw

00000.title: Alternate Forms.
00000.notes: The hrogn can shapeshift its form cosmetically into that of a bat (allowing flight at Move 5), a (large) centipede (Move 1; Climbing-16), or a toad (Move 2; Swimming-16; Amphibious). The alternate shapes are disguises, but thorough ones. It retains its ability to “claw” (or bite, sting, etc) for 1d–4 cutting damage plus its toxic follow-up in all forms.
Add 2d toxic follow-up by spending 1 FP.
00000.name: Baton

00001.notes: Add 2d toxic follow-up by spending 1 FP.
00001.name: Punch

00000.notes: Costs 1 FP.
00000.name: Elf-shot

00000.title: Hulder weapons are not usually physical; they are tricksome, seductive, and go all-in on lures and mind-influence.
00000.notes: They do possess several unusual powers, including skin that has the toughness of thick bark; that bark shows through on the huldra’s back!

00001.title: Elf-shot.
00001.notes: By spending 1 FP, the hulder can add 2d toxic damage to any attempt to cause injury, whether it be a brawling or grappling attack, or a weapon strike. This is follow-up injury, and requires no hit roll. Hulder may also throw the elf-shot. Treat as Innate Attack-15, Acc 1, 1/2D 25, Max 50. The Elf-shot comes instantly to hand and does not require preparation: The hulder just chucks it.

00002.title: Entrancing Dance.
00002.notes: Some of the hulder’s spells are cast as part of an alluring sensual dance. The hulder must be dancing to cast Charm, Daze, Foolishness, Sleep, or Stun. Any conditions that interfere with the hulder’s Dancing skill reduce their spellcasting ability by a like amount. Don’t roll twice! The dance is the spell.

00001.name: Dependency (Uncomfortably Cold Environment) (1 HP per minute)

00000.title: Avalanche!
00000.notes: Costs 2 FP per use. A nearby embankment of snow and ice collapses and rushes to the party in a line 10 yards wide, traveling 50 yards. You can only get out of the attack’s pathway (or fly upwards!). Creatures are subject to 6d crushing for knockback only. Movement costs double in the snow and-ice covered terrain.

00001.title: Ice Bind.
00001.notes: Costs 1 FP per use. Delvers’ feet freeze to the ground: 1d+1 control that automatically hits any body parts touching the ground. Area effect, 2-yard radius.

00002.title: Ice Shield.
00002.notes: Costs 1 FP. An icy shield with DB 2 and DR 10. It lasts until it shatters if its DR is exceeded. It forms instantly when a block is attempted.

00003.title: Snowball Fight (16).
00003.notes: A flurry of hard-packed ice spheres each doing 1d (0.5) crushing fills a cone with Range 30, 15-yard maximum width. Targets are attacked 2d times (roll for each victim). You may block or dodge, reduce the number of hits by the defender’s margin of success.

00000.notes: Follow-up: [1d burn]. May worry, including burning damage.
00000.name: Bite

00000.title: Flame Breath.
00000.notes: A 1-yard wide, 3-yard-long cone attack. Roll 1d each turn after using the attack; on a roll of 5–6 it can be used again.

00001.notes: May Swallow Whole.
00001.name: Grapple

00000.title: Burning Aura.
00000.notes: 2d (5) burning aura. This harms everyone who the ice centipede strikes or who strikes it in close combat. The fire is hot enough to bypass a Salamander Amulet and melt orichalcum: Treat damage as Corrosive (see Corrosive Attack) vs metal shields; wooden ones are instantly set aflame: see My Shield! ['Exploits, p. 68.'PDF:DFE68]

00001.title: Swallow Whole.
00001.notes: Can swallow anything SM 0 or smaller. Does double Burning Aura damage – 4d (5) burning – as a free action each turn to a swallowed victim!

00022.name: Vulnerability (2× from silver, holy, or enchanted weapons)

00000.notes: 9 lbs.
00000.name: Axe

00001.notes: Treat as weapon, not as body part.

00004.notes: Treat as weapon, not as body part.
00004.name: Grapple

00006.notes: Treat as weapon, not as body part.
00006.name: Punch

00008.notes: Strike rear hexes at no penalty. Treat as weapon, not as body part.
00008.name: Tail

00000.title: Crystal Weapons.
00000.notes: By taking a Concentrate maneuver and spending 1 FP, the ístyrann can create a crystalline axe, dueling glaive, morningstar, or large shield in either hand. Each is treated as Dwarven (may parry normally), with the Shatterproof enchantment.

00001.title: Frostbite Weapon.
00001.notes: On any hit using fists or one of its crystal weapons, the ístyrann can cast Frostbite (['Spells, p. 69'PDF:DFS69']), spending 1–3 FP and doing 1d injury per FP spent.

00002.name: Dependency (Mana, 1 HP/min in no mana zones)

00000.notes: often with Deathtouch follow-up. Reach C.
00000.name: Punch or Touch

00001.notes: often with Deathtouch follow-up. Reach 1.
00001.name: Jo

00000.title: Redecorate.
00000.notes: So long as no other sapient being is watching, the íviðia can completely rearrange the interior of the inside of her dwelling place by taking a Concentrate maneuver. Food and drink must be brought in from Midgard if it is to provide mortal nourishment, as must any reagents needed for alchemy or spellcraft.
Treat as weapon, not as body part.
00000.name: Gore

00000.title: Paralyzing Breath.
00000.notes: The exhalation of the járnuxa behaves as an Area spell, always with Range 2 and an radius of 2 (the target hex and the surrounding hexes). It may only be delivered into the járnuxa’s front hexes. The effect is tenacious: roll 1d at the beginning of each turn, and the cloud dissipates on a roll of 5–6. Roll a HT check at –2; failure results in Petrifaction (['Exploits, p. 66'PDF:DFE66]). It may only be cured with Remove Curse or Stone to Flesh; Dispel Magic won’t work. Roll 1d at the beginning of the járnuxa’s turn: it may use it’s breath weapon again on a roll of 6.
Follow-up: [2d burn]. DR protects normally.
00000.name: Boxing Punch

00001.notes: Follow-up: [2d burn] each turn the subject is grappled. DR protects against grappling follow-up damage.
00001.name: Grapple

00002.notes: Follow-up: [4d burn]. 125 lbs.
00002.name: Giant Flaming Bastard Sword

00003.notes: Follow-up: [4d burn]. 125 lbs.
00003.name: Giant Flaming Bastard Sword

00000.notes: 200 lbs.
00000.name: Thrown Boulder

00000.notes: 61 lbs.
00000.name: Huge Mace

00000.notes: 100 lbs.
00000.name: Thrown Boulder

00000.notes: 50 lbs.
00000.name: Thrown Boulder

00000.notes: May worry for control damage.
00000.name: Chain Binding

00000.title: Get Over Here!
00000.notes: The keðja can grab a foe and pull it towards itself using a variant of Grab and Go (['Fantastic Dungeon Grappling, p. 5'PDF:FDG5]). Roll a Quick Contest of the chain’s ST 18 vs the ST +4 of the target. If it wins, it pulls the victim towards it as if it had Move 8.

00001.title: Only One Per Customer.
00001.notes: A quirk of the chains: It may only grapple targets with one chain each.

00002.title: Plethora of Chains.
00002.notes: The demon can fling out a number of chains equal to its Will stat, plus sufficient local chain-pieces to serve as objects with which it can parry weapon strikes: All parries are made at full skill.

00003.title: Versatile Steel.
00003.notes: The keðja may use its chains at full skill with Karate, Judo, or as a ranged grappling attack.

00002.name: Dependency (Water, 1d FP per minute out of water)

00000.title: Delicious.
00000.notes: The kónglax is really tasty and really nutritious. A typical ST 5 salmon yields 10 meals (2 meals per pound of Basic Lift) for a typical adventurer, and is +2 to any rolls to deal with starvation or food supply issues (frequently IQ-based Survival rolls).

00001.title: Fast Start.
00001.notes: A salmon hunts in bursts of speed, spending 1 FP to allow Move 3 for one turn.

00020.name: Unkillable (Achilles Heel, magical or blessed weapons)

00000.title: Aura of Darkness.
00000.notes: The krabbári is surrounded by an aura that dims all light sources within 10 yards (both natural and magical) to a –6 darkness penalty. Night Vision functions normally (provided there’s some light!) and Dark Vision sees through the aura, but torches, lanterns, and even Continual Light spells provide no better than –6 to vision rolls.

00001.title: Demonic Puppet.
00001.notes: By taking a Concentrate maneuver, the krabbári can take over the mind of any stunned (physical or mental) enemy. This requires a Quick Contest of Will (Resist Evil, Magic Resistance, and Mind Shield definitely apply); if the krabbári wins, the target is affected as if by a Charm spell (['Spells, p. 53'PDF:DFS53]) for minutes equal to their margin of failure (minimum 1 minute) and will attempt to defend the krabbári as soon as it recovers from being stunned.

00002.title: Regeneration.
00002.notes: The krabbári regenerates 10 HP per turn unless reduced to –10xHP (do not multiply this by 3 for its 30 HP; it just regenerates 10 per turn!). It cannot regenerate damage caused by magical or blessed weapons, including any weapon wielded by a character with the Rest in Pieces advantage. If it heals a crippling injury, the crippled body part is restored immediately.

00003.title: Roar of a Thousand Years’ Fury.
00003.notes: Any time the krabbári takes a major wound, it roars in pain; anyone within earshot must make an immediate Fright Check at -2. Reduce the penalty by 1 each time an individual hears the roar.

00004.title: Whispers of the Damned.
00004.notes: As a Concentrate maneuver, the krabbári targets one creature with IQ 6+ within sight who begins to hear the voices of damned souls in their mind. After three seconds of this treatment, the target is mentally stunned and must roll Will each turn to snap out of it. There is no resistance roll against this power, but the krabbári can only use it once on each target in a given encounter.

00002.notes: Attacks target hex at +4.
00002.name: Stabbing Leg

00004.notes: Area attack, 3 yards wide and 20 yards long.
00004.name: Tentacle Smash

00000.title: Release the Kraken.
00000.notes: There are enough legends of a spell that can summon and perhaps direct the kraken that wizards keep looking for it. But lacking this particular spell or ability, no way of controlling the creature is known: the usual fare in Spells won’t work.

00001.title: That’s Really All The Arms.
00001.notes: The kraken has eight flexible tentacles (like an octopus) with DR 10. It sports two crablike crushing claws with DR 20. Each of its four legs tapers to a hardened point. The octopus tentacles are 70 yards long; the crab claws reach 20 yards. The legs can only attack close to its 30-yard-long main body.

00002.title: The Wind-up, The Pitch …
00002.notes: The kraken is ponderous. The tentacles and legs are powerful but slow. Treat each such an attack as a two-turn maneuver: Declare and mark a target hex on the first turn, and then the attack strikes home on the second turn. This gives delvers a chance to move out of the way, but since the tentacles are area attacks, they Scatter (['Exploits, p. 45'PDF:DFE45]). So long as a delver is paying attention, they’ll probably only get squished by accident. Ships and towns? Not so fortunate.

00003.title: Wounded a Little.
00003.notes: The kraken doesn’t like injury much. If it suffers enough damage to cripple a tentacle (more than 250 HP!) or even inflict pain (50 injury for –1 due to shock; spells might do it if you can afford the energy cost), it decides to play elsewhere. If something angers it or it’s been summoned via a secret spell? Far, far more determined.

00003.name: Dependency (Loses 1 HP per minute in no-mana areas)

00019.name: Unhealing (Heals only when Unkillable is triggered)

00021.name: Achilles Heel, Can be truly killed in no-mana areas)

00000.notes: – usually with a horrid spell, like 6d worth of Deathtouch. Reach 1, 2.
00000.name: Staff

00000.title: Rule of 20.
00000.notes: Rule of 16? Pah. That’s for chumps. Any spell where the Rule of 16 applies, use 20 as the maximum instead.

00001.title: Two-for-One!
00001.notes: The lich can pump two seconds worth of energy into a spell in the first second of concentration. This doesn’t impact casting skill.

00002.title: Zombiepalooza.
00002.notes: A lich can create 1d mindless undead (skeletons or zombies; mindful undead are such a bother) per FP spent, up to its Magery, with a Concentrate. That’s in combat. They’ll have more.

00003.title: Arcane Mastery.
00003.notes: Eilíflega knows every spell in the given colleges at the given level. If it can see, sense, or divine that trouble is coming in the form of a party, or an army, it consults its books and prepares special surprises in advance. Pay attention to the FP cost and time reduction of spells it knows well: It can maintain Blur at –3 or deliver 3d Deathtouch or Sunbolt spells for funsies at no cost. It casts Great Haste in one second. Death Vision? Stuns a foe each turn at no FP cost. It can Blink for free all day long without having to make Body Sense rolls—and yes, this breaks two rules; maybe it knows something you don’t know? More than most creatures, a lich is dangerous by virtue of the GM knowing what the threats are and preparing for them in advance so as not to slow down the game!

00001.notes: Control points do not last past the liefar’s turn.
00001.name: Shadow Grapple

00000.title: Shadow Blades.
00000.notes: The liefar’s attacks bypass all mundane DR (it can ignore walls, it can ignore armor). Armor enchanted with Fortify reduces damage only by the magically bestowed bonuses. Attacks by the liefar cannot be parried or blocked, only dodged.

00001.title: Spirit Form.
00001.notes: The liefar may cross any medium (even solid matter) at full Move, and renders it immune to physical dangers and most magic. Liefars are immune to harm from any material source other than people and objects under the influence of Affect Spirits (['Spells, p. 59'PDF:DFS59]), and weapons enchanted with Ghost Weapon (['Exploits, p. 79'PDF:DFE79]). These affect such a spirit as if it were living, though apparent body parts are undifferentiated: All hits count as torso hits.

00002.notes: Claws add Control DR 3.
00002.name: Grapple

00003.notes: Pounce up to 10 yards. ['See Exploits, p. 40.'PDF:DFE40].
00003.name: Pounce

00000.title: Super Jump (10 yards).
00000.notes: Use this figure as Move for pouncing. Cats can jump five to six times their height both vertically and horizontally (their musculature is optimized for height).
Also inflicts 2d burning follow-up. 36.75 lbs.
00000.name: Flaming Broadsword

00001.notes: Also inflicts 2d burning follow-up. 36.75 lbs.
00001.name: Flaming Broadsword

00002.notes: Victim suffers effects of Hot Bod for duration of grapple.
00002.name: Grapple

00003.notes: Treat as weapon, not as body part. Includes bonus for hooves.
00003.name: Karate Kick

00004.notes: Treat as weapon, not as body part.
00004.name: Karate Punch

00005.notes: Treat as weapon, not as body part. Can strike into any arc!
00005.name: Spiked Tail

00000.title: Fires of Muspelheim.
00000.notes: The logaskuggi controls shadow and flame as second nature. On its turn, it may employ any one of the following abilities as a free action.

00001.title: Caustic Cloud.
00001.notes: Creates a two-yard radius cloud of fire and smoke, anywhere within 70 yards of the logaskuggi so long as it has line of sight or can locate a target hex with Detect. Treat it as a combination of a 1d+2 (5) burning Fire Cloud (['Spells, p. 30'PDF:DFS30]) As well as a nastier version of Smoke (['Spells, p. 32'PDF:DFS32]). Roll 3d for each cloud on the demons’ turn: Any given cloud extinguishes on a roll of 6 or less. Unlike Smoke, the blindness and coughing persist until a victim makes a HT roll. Even afterwards, blurry vision gives –3 to combat skills and Vision rolls until cured with a suitable spell or potion: Cure Disease, any Healing spell, or Restore Sight work, as do healing potions, and the Universal Antidote.

00002.title: Fire Walk.
00002.notes: The logaskuggi can teleport to any source of flame—including its own creations or delver’s lanterns and torches—within 70 yards. Divert Teleport and Teleport Shield have their usual effects, but the demon’s teleport ability is Skill-24. If the demon bursts into existence in the same hex as another creature, it is treated as a shove doing 8d–2 knockback only, and potentially forcing a Fright Check on the unwary.

00003.title: Incinerate.
00003.notes: Creates a burst of infernal flame, doing 3d burning injury to all in the target hex (it is unerring with targeting so long as it can Detect the hex). Armor doesn’t protect, but natural DR does. Target may employ a retreating dodge at –5 to take half damage.

00004.title: Pool of Flame.
00004.notes: Creates a two-yard radius infernal fire that does 1d–1 (5) burning per second. The logaskuggi may place the center of the pool anywhere within 70 yards, so long as it can see or Detect the target hex. Lasts until extinguished by the demon as a free action.

00005.title: Scorching Missile Shield.
00005.notes: A DR 15 super-hot shield melts or incinerates all missiles launched at the logaskuggi this turn, regardless of composition: It melts meteoric iron or iron or orichalcum just fine, incinerates wood, etc. It offers no protection against melee attacks or spell energies.

00006.title: Wreathed in Shadow.
00006.notes: The logaskuggi is at –5 to hit with attacks this turn. Sense rolls to detect the demon are at –5 if it’s moving, and –10 if it’s still.

00007.title: Hot Bod.
00007.notes: Being in the same hex with or striking the demon does 2d burning damage. This also applies to weapons: Treat metal weapons as having DR 6, wooden as DR 4. Grappling with the creature inflicts 4d per second burning damage.

00008.title: Omniscient Eye.
00008.notes: The logaskuggi’s Detect abilities can sense either life (all the better to kill you with) or fire (to enable Fire Walk) on a 12 or less at its Fire Walk range of 70 yards. It also can see as if constantly maintaining Astral Vision, Dark Vision, Know Illusion, Infravision, See Invisible, and Mage Sight. It knows you’re there: It sees spirits and insubstantial entities, sees through darkness, detects heat, cannot be fooled by illusion or invisibility, and sees magic.

00002.notes: Sometimes use a rock as a fist load for 1d+1 crushing.
00002.name: Punch

00003.notes: Usually targets neck.
00003.name: Slashing Claws

00000.title: Death Gaze.
00000.notes: As a free action once per turn, the hag turns her mortifying glare on a target she can see within 30 yards. The victim must make a HT-5 roll or suffer 1d toxic injury that ignores DR.

00001.title: Bard Song.
00001.notes: The lygasöngur knows Song of Command, Song of Humiliation, and Song of Terror.

00000.notes: Parry: +2.
00000.name: Wizard’s Staff

00001.notes: Parry: +2.
00001.name: Wizard’s Staff

00002.notes: Treat as weapon, not as body part. Can be used to parry.
00002.name: Tusk Gore

00000.notes: Only while tangible or against an intangible foe.
00000.name: Grapple

00001.notes: Only while tangible or against an intangible foe.
00001.name: Punch

00000.title: Nightmare Haunting.
00000.notes: Induces traumatic night terrors from which the victim cannot wake until the hag releases them or dawn breaks. Each night, the victim must win a Quick Contest of Will with the hag; losing the contest results in them suffering the loss of 1d Fatigue Points, which can only be recovered with a restful night’s sleep (Sleep Fatigue, ['Exploits, p. 65'PDF:DFE65]). A Protection from Evil spell cast on the target provides DR and Magic Resistance against this effect; Pentagram and Astral Block stop it completely. If the target dies from exhaustion, its soul is trapped in an enchanted bag in the martröð’s possession, which must be opened and the spirit freed before resurrection can be effected.

00001.title: Sunlight is My Destroyer!
00001.notes: If the martröð is exposed to the true daylight sun, she must a HT roll or die instantly.

00002.title: Tangible Fear.
00002.notes: The only time the martröð is not in her Spirit Form is while she is feeding. During this time, she can be injured normally.

00001.notes: Claws provide Control DR 3 when breaking free of a claw-based grapple.
00001.name: Claw

00002.notes: For follow-up after a bite or grapple using the claws.
00002.name: Grapple

00000.notes: Includes full jumping Move.
00000.name: Pounce

00000.title: Neck Biter.
00000.notes: Mountain cats instinctively seek to bite and strangle prey on their neck. They target the neck at –3 instead of the usual –5.

00001.title: Strangle.
00001.notes: The mountain cat strangles its prey after biting the neck. Roll a Quick Contest: the cat’s bite ST 16 vs. the higher of its prey’s ST or HT. If the cat wins, it inflicts crushing damage equal to its margin of victory ×1.5 for the neck; DR protects normally. A victim who suffers any injury also starts to suffocate (Suffocation, ['Exploits, p. 70'PDF:DFE70]): On their next turn and every later turn until they escape, they lose 1 FP.

00002.title: Super Jump (7 yards).
00002.notes: The mountain cat can leap vertically or horizontally the same distance.

00000.notes: Follow-up: [1d toxic] (1d per 10 seconds and repeats for 6 cycles).
00000.name: Bite

00000.title: Go Get Her, Ray!
00000.notes: Any hit allows the ormur an immediate roll to grapple, even if it doesn’t penetrate DR. This is a free action.

00001.title: Not Feeling So Good.
00001.notes: Toxic damage in excess of 1/3 the target’s HP means the victim is Nauseated (['Exploits, p. 65'PDF:DFE65]) until a Neutralize Poison spell is cast or the HP are fully restored.

00000.title: Summon Trolls.
00000.notes: The mýrartröll can summon up to three trolls, usually either grendelkin or thurs, to serve her. She frequently covers them with Illusion Disguise so that at a distance they resemble large humanoids, her “husband” and “sons.” Big, strong lads, they are.

00000.name: Dependency (Water, 1 FP per 5 minutes out of water)

00000.title: Breath Holding.
00000.notes: The narwhal can hold its breath underwater for 25 minutes.

00001.title: Tusk Fencing.
00001.notes: Narwhals have been seen to use their tusks to bludgeon and stun fish, after which they eat them. This is their tusk-based crushing attack. It would almost seem a waste, though, not to allow narwhals Rapier-13; the subtle and dexterous motions of hunting narwhals don’t preclude such … and it’s a lot more fun.

00000.title: Commander Headbutt.
00000.notes: If a headbutt attack is made by 3 or more, the target is hit by two horns!

00001.title: Hook ‘em, Horns!
00001.notes: The nautamaðr’s horns can be used to parry blows to its head as weapons at Parry-12.

00002.title: Thick Skull.
00002.notes: The nautamaðr skull has DR 4 instead of DR 2.

00000.notes: Follow-up: Elf-shot (Manablast).
00000.name: Punch

00001.notes: Elf-Shot (Severe pain) if hit.
00001.name: Excruciating Touch

00000.title: Hidden Labor.
00000.notes: Nisse are tireless workers, doing small chores, repairs, and household cleaning tasks as needed to keep entropy at bay. They do the work silently and invisibly (sometimes literally), and never work while being watched by mortals.
Can add Elf-Shot for bonus injury on contact.
00000.name: Grapple

00000.title: Enchanting Voice.
00000.notes: Speaking with the nix is enthralling, and the nix gets +2 to reaction rolls to anyone hearing her voice. The bonus to skills provided by Voice is already included.

00001.title: Fish Friend.
00001.notes: Can talk to and influence fish as if always under the effects of Beast Speech and Fish Control. Not always terribly useful, but you never know.

00002.title: Shapeshifter.
00002.notes: The nix can take 10 seconds to transform into a pony, large fish, non-venomous snake, or human. ST increases to 14 for the pony, and Slippery only pertains to the water forms.

00003.title: Siren Song.
00003.notes: When the nix sings, she can target one specific individual and subject them to the Fascinate spell (['Spells, p. 54'PDF:DFS54]). She uses this to allow her to sing her Song of Command for up to an hour (+4 bonus!). Both abilities are cast at Skill-20 (but are subject to the Rule of 16).

00006.name: Dependency (Mana, 1 HP/min in no mana zones)

00014.name: ["Short Attention Span  (12)" CR:12 Short Attention Span ]

00003.notes: Follow-up: 1 point toxic.
00003.name: Long Knife

00000.notes: Follow-up: 1 point toxic.
00000.name: Bow

00000.title: Corrosion Attack.
00000.notes: Any target engulfed by the jelly takes 1d–2 corrosive damage as Large-Area Injury per second. Metal objects take double damage; orichalcum is still safe.

00001.title: Engulfing Attack.
00001.notes: 4d+2 control on first turn; may worry for 2d+1 thereafter.

00002.title: Keep on Moving.
00002.notes: The jelly must win a Grab and Go (['Fantastic Dungeon Grappling, p. 5'PDF:FDG5]) contest of its ST 24 vs the target’s ST+4 in order to keep moving. It can continue at its full move if it has engulfed creatures with total ST of 12 or less, half Move at total ST 13–24, and two yards if the total ST is ST 25–36. Regardless of ST, it cannot engulf creatures of SM +1 or higher.

00003.title: That’s My Sword!
00003.notes: Those with orichalcum weapons or just a really good Parry or Block score may want to do retreating versions of those defenses to clear out of the jelly’s path. Go ahead … but it’s going to engulf your weapon, and if the control rolled is more than half your Control Maximum (ST/2 unless you have Lifting ST or grappling skills), it disarms you, keeps your weapon, and moves right along.

00001.notes: Venomous.
00001.name: Bite

00000.title: So Many Arms.
00000.notes: The octopus gains the benefit of all eight arms (+3 per die to control point rolls) while grappling. Suction cups provide Control DR equal to their Arm ST/4: Control DR 5 for giant octopuses, and Control DR 3 for regular ones.

00001.title: Venomous Bite.
00001.notes: All octopuses are venomous to some degree. The venom from mildly toxic species causes moderate pain on a failed HT roll, or severe pain on a critical failure, lasting for 25-HT minutes. Lethally toxic species immediately inflict Nausea; every minute, the victim makes a HT roll or loses 1d FP due to oxygen deprivation. When FP goes negative, Paralysis sets in until the victim dies, critically succeeds on a HT roll for FP loss, or is cured.
Venomous.
00001.name: Bite

00000.title: So Many Arms.
00000.notes: The octopus gains the benefit of all eight arms (+3 per die to control point rolls) while grappling. Suction cups provide Control DR equal to their Arm ST/4: Control DR 5 for giant octopuses, and Control DR 3 for regular ones.

00001.title: Venomous Bite.
00001.notes: All octopuses are venomous to some degree. The venom from mildly toxic species causes moderate pain on a failed HT roll, or severe pain on a critical failure, lasting for 25-HT minutes. Lethally toxic species immediately inflict Nausea; every minute, the victim makes a HT roll or loses 1d FP due to oxygen deprivation. When FP goes negative, Paralysis sets in until the victim dies, critically succeeds on a HT roll for FP loss, or is cured.

00000.notes: 2 yards per FP.
00000.name: Air Jet

00001.notes: HT–3 or physical stun. ['See Spells, p. 15'PDF:DFS15] for details.
00001.name: Concussion

00000.title: Air Jet.
00000.notes: The óséðmorðingr can create an Air Jet just as per the spell (['Spells, p. 15'PDF:DFS15]), but doesn’t require Magery to do so, and this ability does not require mana to work!

00001.title: Attack Tactics.
00001.notes: The unseen murderer always grapples the target first with a thick-air attack, then attacks with the Airblade on vulnerable spots. It uses Concussion or Air Jet to deal with companions (stunning or knocking them back). When using its Brawling to attack with the Airblade, it usually targets neck (Airblade-15) or limbs at Airblade-14 with –2 to defenses due to Deceptive Attack.

00002.title: Concussion.
00002.notes: As per the spell, but as with Air Jet, does not require mana to function.

00003.title: I Will Find You!
00003.notes: The creature has a detect range measured in miles equal to half its Perception score. It is pointed in the general direction of the quarry by whomever summoned it, and then turned loose. Once it picks up the target’s location, it homes in relentlessly.

00001.notes: Talons have Control DR 1 if any injury is inflicted.
00001.name: Grapple with Talons

00002.notes: Can worry with talons (called “kneading” in birds).
00002.name: Talons

00000.title: Directional Hearing.
00000.notes: Owls’ ears provide very detailed information on the direction and distance of noises it can hear, processing the information to provide a biological passive Sonar capability (['Monsters, p. 12'PDF:DFM12]). This is not echolocation, like bats and dolphins—it will never give the owl away! If they can hear it, they can “see” it!
Follow-up: Decelerating Venom.
00000.name: Bite

00000.title: Astral Vision.
00000.notes: The spider can see beings in both Svartalfheim and Midgard, as if under a permanent Astral Vision spell (['Spells, p. 42'PDF:DFS42]).

00001.title: Decelerating Venom.
00001.notes: A victim bitten for any injury by the phase spider must roll HT–4 or be afflicted with the Slow condition, allowing action every second turn. Additional bites and failed HT rolls increase the interval by one turn per bite (a poor sap bitten four times acts every five turns).

00002.title: Shadow Walker.
00002.notes: By taking a Concentrate maneuver, the spider can shift into the shadow dimension that is Svartalfheim as per Ethereal Body (['Spells, p. 57'PDF:DFS57]), with the exception that the spider is invisible while there.

00000.name: Dependency (Water, 1 FP per 5 minutes out of water)

00001.notes: See Slams, Overrun, and Trampling (['Exploits, p. 40'PDF:DFE40]).
00001.name: Slam

00002.notes: Rear hex only.
00002.name: Tail Smash

00000.title: Breath Holding.
00000.notes: A physeter can hold its breath underwater for 90 minutes.

00001.title: Extreme Dimorphism.
00001.notes: The female physeter is SM +4, ST 50. Trample and Smash at 5d+2, Slam at 5d+20.

00000.title: Dissolution.
00000.notes: Can use the movement portion of any maneuver to crawl atop anyone who’s lying down and currently unable to make active defenses (for whatever reason). This is a free action, costs no movement points, and automatically inflicts control points equal to the pudding’s ST (40 control), or pins the target if using those rules. A victim who regains defenses (e.g., wakes up) may try to break free in the usual fashion. Good luck. This engulfing inflicts 1 point of corrosion damage to anything but ceramics and glasses as Large-Area Injury every 10 seconds unless the subject’s outfit is sealed. Anyone killed this way is digested and beyond resurrection.

00001.title: Tremor Sense.
00001.notes: The larger puddings can not only taste a trail, but can feel footsteps. They start to ooze towards prey as soon as they detect its footsteps.

00000.notes: Only magical DR or defenses protect.
00000.name: Wilting Touch

00000.title: Drink Life.
00000.notes: The raiður concentrates for one round, focusing upon a single victim it can see directly. If the wraith wins a Quick Contest of Will, the victim suffers 2d injury and the raiður heals for half as many HP as injury rolled!

00001.title: Raise Dead.
00001.notes: By taking a Concentrate maneuver and spending 1 FP, a wraith instantly raises a draug or a liefar from a corpse. Final Rest prevents the animation of the dead. Weapons and armor do not spontaneously appear; the draug needs to find them. It may only have a single created entity active at one time.

00002.title: Semi-Material.
00002.notes: The wraith’s attacks are incorporeal: Defending requires magical weapons and armor to be effective (enchanted weapons or armor, or Shield, Protection from Evil, blocking spells, etc.). Magical weapons do full damage; magical armor includes its mundane DR.

00003.title: Withering Aura.
00003.notes: Anything living within 1-yard reach must roll HT-4 each second or suffer 1d–1 toxic damage. This is an incorporeal Large-area Injury attack (['Exploits, p. 53'PDF:DFE53]). Non-magical DR does not protect (see Semi-Material)! This is a passive effect and does not require any action from the wraith.

00000.notes: Follow-up: Septic Bite.
00000.name: Bite and Claw

00001.notes: Follow-up: Septic Bite. May worry.
00001.name: Grappling Bite

00000.title: Fast Start.
00000.notes: A rokk eðla can spend 2 FP to double its move for one turn.

00001.title: Septic Bite.
00001.notes: The rokk eðla’s mouth is filthy with germs. Check for the bite going septic if any biting injury is taken during an encounter. ['See Monstrous Diseases, pp. 23–24'PDF:NB23].

00002.title: Tail Swipe.
00002.notes: The rokk eðla attacks with its tail into all of its rear hexes as a cone attack with Reach 3 and width 3. Any in the area take 5d crushing or double that for knockback only.

00000.notes: Follow-up: Paralyzing Bite.
00000.name: Bite

00000.title: Paralyzing Bite.
00000.notes: Each time the victim is bitten by the rokktyggja, roll vs HT. On a failure, the target suffers from Petrifaction, turning to alabaster in seconds. The condition is temporary: Every 12 hours, make a HT roll and the victim recovers naturally.

00002.name: Dependency (Water, 1d FP per minute out of water)

00000.notes: May bite and worry.
00000.name: Bite

00000.title: Feeding Frenzy.
00000.notes: After tasting or smelling blood, if a white shark fails its self-control roll for Berserk by 3 or more, it attacks anything it can see or sense, including other sharks.

00000.title: Mana Sense.
00000.notes: Add the level of Magery or Power Investiture of any potential targets in the water to the shark’s Perception rolls. If the shark detects a magical creature, it attacks it preferentially.

00000.title: Strength Drain.
00000.notes: The skuggi’s melee attack is similar to the Debility spell (['Spells, pp. 20–21'PDF:DFS20]), and causes 1d (3) ST loss on a successful hit as Large-Area Injury (['Exploits, p. 53'PDF:DFE53]). If the target’s ST is reduced to zero, it dies and will rise as a haturljós upon the next sunset.

00000.title: Instinctive Saddle Training.
00000.notes: Sleipnisfolald add +2 to Riding skill for their rider, as a naturally capable mount.

00001.title: Teleport Gate.
00001.notes: Once per day, sleipnisfolald can walk between realms, passing from their current location to another plane of existence. The gate lasts only long enough to transport the horse, its rider, and any gear carried. The sleipnisfolald must be familiar with the destination to make the trip.
