00000.name: Stunning Shriek

00000.title: Demon Spores.
00000.notes: The sokkvári spends 2 FP and exhales a cloud of demonic spores. DR from effects such as Protection from Evil protects. Anyone in the area of effect when it hits must roll HT–4 each following turn or take 1d–2 toxic injury; additionally, make a separate HT roll or lose 1d levels of Power Investiture (Clerical) until the toxic effects end. Any success on a subsequent HT roll ends both effects. This is a 2-hex radius area effect attack; roll scatter on a miss! (['See Area and Spreading Attacks, Exploits, pp. 44–45'PDF:DFE44]).

00001.title: Fatigue Battery.
00001.notes: The sokkvári spends no more than 8 FP during a fight on spores and shrieking, after which it becomes a pure melee combatant.

00002.title: Stunning Shriek.
00002.notes: Costs 4 FP. Aimed at a hex. All within 10 yards must roll HT–1 or be physically stunned. Stunned targets must make HT–1 rolls each second to recover. Sokkvári are immune to these effects. Hearing protection gives its bonus to this roll; earplugs and the like give +1 per –1 to Hearing rolls, to a maximum of +5.

00000.notes: Back hexes only, not capped as Wild Swing. Counts as weapon, not as body part.
00000.name: Back-hoof Kick

00002.notes: Counts as weapon, not as body part.
00002.name: Charge Attack

00003.notes: Counts as weapon, not as body part.
00003.name: Charge Attack

00004.notes: Counts as weapon, not as body part.
00004.name: Front-hoof Punch

00000.title: Blessed Attacks.
00000.notes: The spjóthestr’s attacks are considered Holy, as well as being a Ghost Weapon capable of affecting spirits.

00001.title: Phase Walk.
00001.notes: Can phase into Svartalfheim on its turn, disappearing from normal sight, and take Move maneuvers in any direction and medium. Can return to Midgard at any time as a free action. Treat this as Ethereal Body, but invisible to those without Astral Sight or the equivalent.

00002.title: Shield Spell.
00002.notes: Maintains a DB 1 shield as a spell on. For free.

00003.title: Spellcasting.
00003.notes: The spjóthestr knows all its spells at level 15 or higher; casting costs are reduced. It is sensitive to Nature’s Strength, but casts all sorts of spells normally allowed to clerics and wizards. Spjóthestr don’t care.

00004.title: Universal Counterspell.
00004.notes: It can use Counterspell on anything, as if it knew all spells. Spjóthestr refuse to divulge the nature of this power, but all wizards and liches surveyed agree it’s really cool.

00000.notes: Swallow Whole. Prey begins to suffocate (['Exploits, p. 70'PDF:DFE70]).
00000.name: Bite

00000.title: Super Jump.
00000.notes: Frogs are prodigious jumpers, and can cover a distance 20× their body length. Find a frog’s jump distance by looking up the frog’s Size Modifier +8 (!!) on the Size and Speed/Range Table (['Exploits, p. 98'PDF:DFE98]). A SM 0 giant frog can leap an astonishing 50 yards, and is treated as having Move 50 for the purposes of slams and pounces when jumping. Toads prefer shorter hops: add 2–4 to the SM to get jumping distance.

00005.name: Dependency (Rest in own tomb 1/3 of each day or lose 1 HP/hour)

00000.title: Health Drain.
00000.notes: If the vaettr makes a successful brawling or grappling attack, it drains 1d–1 HT from the target as if the victim had been hit by Frailty-20; this does not cost FP. A creature that is reduced to HT 0 dies and rises the following night as a vaettrhrogn under the vaettr’s control. HT recovers at 1 point per hour of rest.

00000.title: Sense Death.
00000.notes: The Valkyries can sense impending violent death, and are drawn to it. They occasionally intervene to prevent a death—or allow one to occur—for reasons known only to them and the Allfather.

00000.notes: Can see insubstantial entities (['Spells, p. 42'PDF:DFS:42]).

00001.title: Enhanced Turning.
00001.notes: As Turning, plus 1d burning per second (see Hand of Asgard, p. 4).

00002.title: Warding Dismissal.
00002.notes: The verndanda can perform a complete Exorcism ritual with nothing more than a stern glare. Take a Concentrate maneuver and roll the Quick Contest of Exorcism-20 vs the target’s Will. The verndanda is a divine protector: It is a high holy symbol, and is immune to the Rule of 16 for exorcism.

00000.title: Disad Detector.
00000.notes: The ýlirköttur can detect individuals with Greed, Kleptomania, Laziness, and Miserliness, and targets those first and fiercest. If presented with multiple such targets, it goes for those with the lowest self-control numbers.
